page.title: 02Farming in the Sampford area
page.content: Farms are mainly seeded pasture for grazing.Dairy herds are diminishing because of the milk quotas.Sheep and beef are increasing,there is some arable farming.There is rough grazing on Chapple moor which is boggy in places. The future of farming is intricately linked to changes in the Common Market Agricultural policy.Dairying will probably decline further,with increases in sheep,beef and arable. Environmental concern may lead to better management of woods and the retention of permanent pasture on the wetter land.Changes in the occupancy of a number of farms could lead to pressure on these areas against the general trend.A move towards world commodity price levels would produce pressure on farm incomes and a need to combine farms or supplementing income.
